medical_history.chief_complaint: Burning epigastric/mid-sternal pain with nausea, vomiting, and abdominal pain
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began around noon after breakfast, with heartburn evolving into epigastric/mid-sternal pain and acid-brash. By 3 PM, nausea and diffuse mid/upper abdominal pain developed. Symptoms persisted through the afternoon with recurrent vomiting every 30 minutes, initially food material then bile with small flecks of blood. Denotes subjective mild fever and warmth.
medical_history.social_history: Immigrant, married, living conditions not specified. Smokes unspecified number of cigarettes daily. Rare alcohol consumption.
